meanings.definition: The act of unloading or relieving a burden.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, the disburdenments of stress through yoga felt refreshing.
meanings.sent2: The disburdenments of heavy boxes from the truck made the job easier.
meanings.sent3: The disburdenments of carrying groceries up the stairs turned into a fun workout.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted as disburdenments, lifting the heavy mood in the room.
meanings.sent5: The disburdenments of worries floated away like balloons in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The disburdenments of paperwork allowed him to focus on more important tasks.
meanings.sent2: She felt relief after the disburdenments of organizing the event were complete.
meanings.sent3: The disburdenments of doing laundry magically disappeared when the laundry fairy visited.
meanings.sent4: The disburdenments of guilt weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The disburdenments of old habits paved the way for new beginnings.
